oai_dc:dc.dc:title: On the path coverage by a non homogeneous sensor field
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: MANOHAR, P
RAM, SS
MANJUNATH, D
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We analyze the statistical properties of the coverage of a one-dimensional path induced by a two dimensional non homogeneous random sensor network. Sensor locations form a non homogeneous Poisson process and coverage area of each sensor is a circle of random i.i.d. radius. We first describe the one-dimensional coverage process on the line and describe an equivalent time-inhomogeneous Mt/Gt/8 queue whose busy period statistics will be equal to the coverage statistics of the line. We also obtain properties like conditional forward and backward hole-lengths. Additional results for the case of fixed coverage radius are obtained. We also obtain some numerical results for a deployment that has a 'Laplacian' intensity function.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: IEEE Global Telecommunications Conference (GLOBECOM 06),San Francisco, CA,NOV 27-DEC 01, 2006
